description:
When Sakamoto meets Aoi, the convenience store clerk, it’s love at first sight — and just like that, he retires.

Sakamoto gets married, has a daughter, opens a mom-and-pop store in a quiet town, and completely transforms … into a plus-size man. To ensure a peaceful life with his beloved family, the legendary ex–hit man bands together with comrades to face off against the looming threat of assassins.

(Source: Netflix TUDUM)

Note: The series is streaming a week in advance on Netflix Japan starting with episode 2 released alongside episode 1.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Triads
tags.description: Centered around Chinese organised crime syndicates.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/inokoriinosan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岸本卓)

Originally an employee at [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

Designer, director, and animator originally from [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11). He made his directorial debut in 2018 with [Megalo Box](https://anilist.co/anime/100298). Frequently works with [Tetsurou Araki](https://anilist.co/staff/100088).

[Website](https://vaundy.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/vaundy_engawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/vaundy_engawa/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1FQWQ3y3-e8l1pCtWhJt5A)

Vaundy is a Japanese multi-talented artist who writes, composes and arranges music all by himself, his talents also expand to direction and self-production of designs and music videos.

Since his first music video posted on YouTube in spring of 2019, his songs “Tokyo Flash” and “Fukakouryoku” have since become social media sensations.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

__Alma Mater:__ Toyo University

__[Website](https://www.yukihayashi.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayayu1231)__

__Introduction:__
Yuuki Hayashi is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with Legendoor, who used to be a rhythmic gymnast

__Biography:__
His history in music began in university when he started creating music pieces for rhythmic gymnasts as a hobby for 5000 yen a piece. When he started getting requests from other universities for his music, his interest in music producing grew. After graduation, he was taught music for 6 months by a rhythmic gymnastics music producer, and now, he handles music for various sports. He also arranges music for dance, athletic competitions, companies, independent movies and recently, TV dramas and anime.

(Source: MyAnimeList, edited)

[Twitter](https://x.com/Conton_Candy) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/contoncandy_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC7qWNP0x8ydQJCkt5LJJQkw)

Three-member Japanese rock band formed in 2018.
__Yoshihisa Heishi__ is a Japanese magazine editor, animation planner and producer. He currently works for Shueisha and was an editor-in-chief for Weekly Shounen Jump between 2011-2017.

title.native: 僕のヒーローアカデミア
